name: Authentic Mexican Picadillo
author: mytable_yourtummy
summary: Picadillo is a popular dish in most South American cuisines. It is made with lean ground beef (or can be made with ground turkey as well), tomatoes, potatoes, and other ingredients. This authentic recipe will bring the flavors of Mexico to your plate.
ingredients: 1 (7.75 ounce) can Mexican-style hot tomato sauce (such as El Pato®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Bring 6 whole tomatoes to a boil in a small pot
Add 3/4 cup water, onion halves, and whole garlic clove
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add chopped onion and serrano pepper
Add minced garlic; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add chopped tomato and cook for 1 minute more
Add ground beef; cook until browned, about 8 minutes
Pour canned tomato sauce into the beef mixture
Cook for 2 minutes; add the blended tomatoes, jalapeno, chicken bouillon, cumin, and bay leaf
Mix well, reduce heat, and simmer until most of the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes
Let sit for 5 minutes before serving
